lexUnit.name: stutter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: talk with continued involuntary repetition of sounds, especially initial consonants.

sentence.text: ` The b-baby , " he stuttered , trying to resist .
The caller stepped back aghast and stuttered , ` I 'm so sorry to disturb you -- I see you 're changing for dinner . "
` I d-do n't know , Sir , " Lexandro stuttered ; and for once the title of Sir came sincerely to his lips .
` I have n't been well , " she stuttered .
` W-what 's happened ? " she stuttered , suddenly and quite unaccountably nervous .
` And , of course , Rastani , " the chaplain stuttered , squirming on his stool .
` But that 's the exact attitude we have to fight , " stuttered Geoffrey .
` It 's another Returner , Rohmer , " stuttered Gilbert .
I do n't know what to say ! " stuttered the stunned suitor .
When I met Butch I just could n't believe it -- he stuttered worse than me !
He 'd left the court before Lucien could stutter an assent .
Seb also managed to stutter his thanks to Christian before following Carrie to the kitchen where she had gone to put the kettle on the hob to make coffee for everyone .
And he got so he could gradually do without it and he never stuttered again .
He stuttered out what he had to say .
In her fright she had begun to stutter .
He stuttered , then looked down , seeming almost to laugh at himself .
Inarticulate by nature , sometimes he reached such a pitch of high emotion that he felt he had to express it : but his feelings were always too strong for him and made him stutter .
He does n't speak a lot because he stutters .
